definitions.definition: A dish of glass or earthenware, with a lid, in which food is baked and sometimes served.
Food, such as a stew, cooked in such a dish.
To cook like, or as, a casserole; to stew.
An action which divides a thing into parts, or separates one thing from another.
A part of something that has been divided.
An approach to division in which one asks what the size of each part is, rather than (as in quotition) how many parts there are.
The division of a territory into two or more autonomous ones.
definitions.example: Monarchies where partition isn't prohibited risk weakening trough parcellation and civil wars between the heirs

definitions.definition: A vertical structure that divides a room.
definitions.example: a brick partition; lath and plaster partitions

definitions.definition: That which divides or separates; that by which different things, or distinct parts of the same thing, are separated; boundary; dividing line or space.
A part divided off by walls; an apartment; a compartment.
The severance of common or undivided interests, particularly in real estate. It may be effected by consent of parties, or by compulsion of law.
A section of a hard disk separately formatted.
A division of a database or one of its constituting elements such as tables into separate independent parts.
A collection of non-empty, disjoint subsets of a set whose union is the set itself (i.e. all elements of the set are contained in exactly one of the subsets).
A musical score.
To divide something into parts, sections or shares
To divide a region or country into two or more territories with separate political status
To separate or divide a room by a partition (ex. a wall), often use with off
A species of trees of the genus Aesculus, common in the temperate zones of both hemispheres.
The large nutlike seed of these trees.
Any of various heating systems in which a central source of heat is used to distribute heat (and sometimes hot water) throughout a building in a controlled manner.
An upward turn or trend, especially in business activity or profit
To turn (something) up or over
A moving out of place, especially a protrusion of an internal organ
To move out of place; especially for an internal organ to protrude beyond its normal position.
The doctrine that all events are subject to fate or inevitable necessity, or determined in advance in such a way that human beings cannot change them.
Water or other liquid finely suspended in air.
definitions.example: It was difficult to see through the morning mist.

definitions.definition: A layer of fine droplets or particles.
definitions.example: There was an oily mist on the lens.

definitions.definition: Anything that dims, darkens, or hinders vision.
To form mist.
definitions.example: It's misting this morning.

definitions.definition: To spray fine droplets on, particularly of water.
definitions.example: I mist my tropical plants every morning.

definitions.definition: To cover with a mist.
definitions.example: The lens was misted.

definitions.definition: (of the eyes) To be covered by tears.
definitions.example: My eyes misted when I remembered what had happened.

definitions.definition: The punctuation mark "?", used at the end of a sentence to indicate a question.
A state of doubt or uncertainty.
definitions.example: There’s a question mark over whether or not he’ll be fit for the next game.

definitions.definition: An enigmatic, inscrutable, or mysterious person or thing; an enigma, a riddle.
Polygonia interrogationis, a North American nymphalid butterfly with a silver mark on the underside of its hindwing resembling a question mark (sense 1).
The four-dimensional continuum of the three spatial dimensions plus time.

An n-dimensional continuum consisting of dimensions of both space and time. Normally spacetime is considered as having 4 dimensions (x, y, z, t), but higher-dimensional spacetimes are often encountered in theoretical physics, e.g. the 5-dimensional spacetime of Kaluza-Klein theory or the 11 dimensions of spacetime in M-theory.
A specific region of the universe with mathematically different properties than the surrounding spacetime. Synonymous with "metric" within the context of general relativity.
The main commercial or business area of a town, containing the principal shops, banks, restaurants and public traffic hub.
A song or poem greeting or evoking the dawn.
A morning love song; a song of lovers parting in the morning.
A magnetic or electronic device used to determine the cardinal directions (usually magnetic or true north).
A pair of compasses (a device used to draw an arc or circle).
The range of notes of a musical instrument or voice.
A space within limits; an area.
An enclosing limit; a boundary, a circumference.
definitions.example: within the compass of an encircling wall

definitions.definition: Moderate bounds, limits of truth; moderation; due limits; used with within.
Scope.
A passing round; circuit; circuitous course.
To surround; to encircle; to environ; to stretch round.
To go about or round entirely; to traverse.
To accomplish; to reach; to achieve; to obtain.
To plot; to scheme (against someone).
In a circuit; round about.
Permitted amount or activity.
Appropriate; satisfactory; acceptable.
Intellectually admissible; valid; probable.
Able to be added or deducted in consideration of something.
Permissible; tolerable; legitimate.
Praiseworthy.
A young deer.
A pale brown colour tinted with yellow, like that of a fawn.
The young of an animal; a whelp.
To give birth to a fawn.
Of the fawn colour.
A servile cringe or bow.
Base flattery.
To exhibit affection or attempt to please.
To seek favour by flattery and obsequious behaviour (with on or upon).
(of a dog) To show devotion or submissiveness by wagging its tail, nuzzling, licking, etc.
To have high hopes; to be ambitious.
(often plural) An underground system of tunnels and chambers with recesses for graves, used (in former times) as a cemetery; a tunnel system used for burying the dead, as in Paris or Ancient Rome.
Identification with or understanding of the thoughts, feelings, or emotional state of another person.
definitions.example: She had a lot of empathy for her neighbor; she knew what it was like to lose a parent too.

definitions.definition: Capacity to understand another person's point of view or the result of such understanding.
A paranormal ability to psychically read another person's emotions.
MDMA.
To register visually.
To get sight of (something).
definitions.example: to sight land from a ship

definitions.definition: To apply sights to; to adjust the sights of; also, to give the proper elevation and direction to by means of a sight.
definitions.example: to sight a rifle or a cannon

definitions.definition: To take aim at.
Having vision, not blind.
(in combination) Having a particular kind of sight.
Any tropical, climbing orchid of the genus Vanilla (especially Vanilla planifolia), bearing podlike fruit yielding an extract used in flavoring food or in perfumes.
The fruit or bean of the vanilla plant.
The extract of the fruit of the vanilla plant.
The distinctive fragrant flavour/flavor characteristic of vanilla extract.
definitions.example: You can tell that the secret ingredient missing from New CokeTM was vanilla, because certain South American economies collapsed when it was introduced, and miraculously revived when the old formula was used again.

definitions.definition: Any artificially produced homologue of vanilla extract, principally vanillin produced from lignin from the paper industry or from petrochemicals.
(sexuality) Someone who is not into fetishism; a normophile
An unmodded version of a game
A yellowish-white colour, like that of vanilla ice cream.
(of flavor, etc.) Of vanilla.
(retronym) Standard, plain, default, unmodified, basic.
definitions.example: vanilla JavaScript

definitions.definition: (sexuality) Not kinky, not involving BDSM.
Plain; conventional; unimaginative.
District court
Direct current
(degree) doctor of chiropractic
Debit card
(law enforcement) detective constable, a police rank used in Commonwealth countries
Initialism of defined contributions.
Initialism of device context.
The use or distribution of money-saving coupons.
The amount or value listed on a bill, note, stamp, etc.; the stated value or amount.
No more or less than what is stated; a literal or direct meaning or interpretation.
definitions.example: Please take this comment at face value and don't try to read anything into it.

definitions.definition: To satisfy, carry out, bring to completion (an obligation, a requirement, etc.).
definitions.example: You made a promise, son, and now you must fulfill it.

definitions.definition: To emotionally or artistically satisfy; to develop one's gifts to the fullest.
definitions.example: This is the most fulfilling work I've ever done.

definitions.definition: To obey, follow, comply with (a rule, requirement etc.).
definitions.example: Unfortunately, you don't fulfill the criteria for extra grants at the present time.

definitions.definition: To package, distribute, or ship goods.
To fill full; fill to the utmost capacity; fill up.
definitions.example: My lady is positively fulfilled of grace.

definitions.definition: Fulfilment
Which causes fulfilment; emotionally or artistically satisfying.
The termination of an organized body or legislative assembly, especially a formal dismissal.
Disintegration, or decomposition into fragments.
Dissolving, or going into solution.
The quality of being dissolute.
definitions.example: He led a life of dissolution, drinking and gambling almost daily.

definitions.definition: Sly, cunning, full of tricks
definitions.example: Horatio's new girlfriend is a wily coquette and poor Horatio is too smitten to see it.

definitions.definition: Serving to caution or warn; admonitory
Serving to ward off; preventive
Held as security or hostage
A backup or assistant pilot of an aircraft.
Walking steadily, without stumbling; capable of finding good footing.
Confident and capable.
A collection of small particles, particularly dirt, that precipitates from a river or other body of water.
definitions.example: The Nile delta is composed of sediment that was washed down and deposited at the mouth of the river.

definitions.definition: To deposit material as a sediment.
To be deposited as a sediment.
(usually childish) Mother.
To treat someone like a mother would; to mother someone.
(chiefly in the superlative) Characteristic of a mother; motherly.
definitions.example: She is the mommiest of mommies.

definitions.definition: A fixed verse form of Italian origin consisting of fourteen lines that are typically five-foot iambics and rhyme according to one of a few prescribed schemes.
To compose sonnets.
To celebrate in sonnets; to write a sonnet about.
An electric ray of the genus Torpedo.
A cylindrical explosive projectile that can travel underwater and is used as a weapon.
A submarine sandwich.
A naval mine.
An explosive device buried underground and set off remotely, to destroy fortifications, troops, or cavalry; a land torpedo.
A professional gunman or assassin.
A small explosive device attached to the top of the rail to provide an audible warning when a train passes over it.
A kind of firework in the form of a small ball, or pellet, which explodes when thrown upon a hard object.
An automobile with a torpedo body.
(usually in the plural) A woman's shoe with a pointed toe.
(usually in the plural) A large breast; breast with a large nipple.
A marijuana cigarette.
To send a torpedo, usually from a submarine, that explodes below the waterline of the target ship.
To sink a ship with one of more torpedoes.
To undermine or destroy any endeavor with a stealthy, powerful attack.
A mineral, especially a crystal, enclosed within another
A person of the endomorphic physical type, characterised by big bones, round face, large trunk and thighs and a naturally high degree of body fat, especially around the midsection.
A person having a theoretical body type with slow metabolism in which weight is gained easily, but fat levels are hard to reduce. Endomorphic bodybuilders tend to be the most massive.
Generalized pains in the limbs or joints of children or adolescents (from many causes)
Emotional or social problems associated with adolescence
(by extension) difficulties that arise in the early stages of any project
A person who consumes no animal flesh with the exception of fish or seafood.
A manufactured regenerated cellulosic fiber.
An administrative unit of some Eastern European and Asian states.
A ray or beam.
A one-wheeled attachment to a motorcycle to allow for a separate seat for a passenger or cargo space.
A cocktail made with cognac (or brandy), triple sec liqueur, and lemon juice.
Fecal matter, feces.
definitions.example: The dog poop is on the grass.

definitions.definition: The sound of a steam engine's whistle; typically low pitch.
To make a short blast on a horn
To break wind.
To defecate.
definitions.example: His horse pooped right in the middle of the parade.

definitions.definition: A set of data or general information, written or spoken, usually concerning machinery or a process.
definitions.example: Here’s the info paper with the poop on that carburetor.

definitions.definition: To tire, exhaust. Often used with out.
definitions.example: He pooped out a few strides from the finish line.

definitions.definition: The stern of a ship.
The poop deck.
To break seawater with the poop of a vessel, especially the poop deck.
definitions.example: We were pooped within hailing of the quay and were nearly sunk.

definitions.definition: To embark a ship over the stern.
A slothful person.
An offshoot of a larger religion; a group sharing particular (often unorthodox) political and/or religious beliefs.
definitions.example: A religious sect.

definitions.definition: A group following a specific ideal or a leader.
A cutting; a scion.
A traditional English steamed pudding made from some combination of bread or sponge cake or similar ingredients, with dried fruits such as raisins, served with custard or another sweet sauce.
A covering, usually of leather, worn from knee to ankle.
Tight fitting leg coverings worn, for example, to gym.
One of the legs of a pair of trousers.
The process of putting a series of three or more options strikes into the stock market.
To upset the composure of.
To bring into confusion.
To frustrate, discomfit.
definitions.example: The emperor disconcerted the plans of his enemy.

definitions.definition: Ruffled; upset and embarrassed.
Self-consciously distressed.
Frustrated and disarranged.
To play football.
(attributive) relating to the sport of football
A fee-charging private or independent school.

The traditional dress of women in the Indian Subcontinent; an outer garment consisting of a single length of cotton or silk, most often with one end wrapped around the waist to form a skirt, the other draped over the shoulder or head.
To swing back and forth, especially if with a regular rhythm.
definitions.example: A pendulum oscillates slower as it gets longer.

definitions.definition: To vacillate between conflicting opinions, etc.
definitions.example: The mood for change oscillated from day to day.

definitions.definition: To vary above and below a mean value.
To adhere to a tradition or more.
definitions.example: He declined at first, but when his hosts insisted, he bowed to local custom and played his part in the ritual.

definitions.definition: To make flameproof.
Resistant to catching fire.
In flowering plants, the structure in a flower that produces pollen, typically consisting of an anther and a filament.
A balloon that carries meteorological instruments aloft in order to measure, record and return data concerning atmospheric pressure, temperature and humidity
Any of the most likely winners in a contest, election, etc.
One who engages in front running.
A Dutch liqueur made of egg yolks, sugar and strong liquor, typically brandy.
A harbour for small boats.
definitions.example: It's a peaceful marina with not too many boats and yachts.

definitions.definition: A bitless headpiece of rope or straps, placed on the head of animals such as cattle or horses to lead or tie them.
A rope with a noose, for hanging criminals; the gallows rope.
A halter top.
To place a halter on.
definitions.example: What do you mean, you didn't halter the horses when we stopped for the night?

definitions.definition: One who halts or limps; a cripple.
A small knobbed structure in some two-winged insects, one of a pair that are flapped rapidly and function as accelerometers to maintain stability in flight.
Any establishment where travellers can procure lodging, food, and drink.
A tavern.
One of the colleges (societies or buildings) in London, for students of the law barristers.
definitions.example: the Inns of Court; the Inns of Chancery; Serjeants' Inns

definitions.definition: The town residence of a nobleman or distinguished person.
definitions.example: Leicester Inn

definitions.definition: A place of shelter; hence, dwelling; habitation; residence; abode.
To house; to lodge.
To take lodging; to lodge.
Characterized by felicity.
Of a sentence or utterance: semantically and pragmatically coherent; fitting in the context.
definitions.example: This sentence is grammatical; it is just not felicitous.

definitions.definition: The surface of a road consisting of layers of crushed stone (usually tar-coated for modern traffic).
Any road or street.
To cover or surface with macadam.
Any member of the kingdom Fungi; a eukaryotic organism typically having chitin cell walls but no chlorophyll or plastids. Fungi may be unicellular or multicellular.
A spongy, abnormal excrescence, such as excessive granulation tissue formed in a wound.
Of or relating to marriage, or the relationship of spouses; connubial.
A group of organisms having the same specific genotype
To sort, arrange of classify into such groups
A colony of breeding birds or other animals.
A crowded tenement.
A place where criminals congregate, often an area of a town or city.
A person who has physically removed him- or herself from the control or direction of a military or naval unit with the intention of permanently leaving
Motion capture.
Of, or relating to determinism.
(of a Turing machine) Having at most one instruction associated with any given internal state.
(of a system) Having exactly predictable time evolution.

(of an algorithm) Having each state depend only on the immediately previous state, as opposed to having some states depend on backtracking where there may be multiple possible next actions and no way to choose between them except by trying each one and backtracking upon failure.
A recreation room.
Not cultivated by agricultural methods; not prepared for cultivation.
Inadequately educated; lacking art or knowledge
Not attended to or fostered.
A one-piece strapless tube-shaped top worn by women, leaving shoulders and belly-button exposed.
A unit of liquid capacity equal to two pints; one-fourth (quarter) of a gallon. Equivalent to 1.136 liters in the UK and 0.946 liter (liquid quart) or 1.101 liters (dry quart) in the U.S.
Four successive cards of the same suit.
A fourth; a quarter; hence, a region of the earth.
Food cooked in this manner.
To fry quickly in hot oil whilst constantly stirring, especially in a wok or similar pan.
Education at university level or beyond.
A trader who sells goods in a shop, or by retail, in distinction from one who sells by wholesale, or sells door to door.
